item.title: Business Intelligence Analyst (financial district)
item.description:
This position is a mixture of Business Analysis, Project Management and Database Coding. This is a full time, salaried position in a fast-paced environment with short delivery times.

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for defining, specifying, mocking-up, engineering and deploying marketing and business intelligence reports specific to the our clients businesses. The person in this position must be able to meet with clients, help them define reporting requirements, document requirements, help design actual reports and a reporting portal, then ideally build and test the reports / results.

Responsibilities include:
 Engage client and senior advertising agency account management team to define appropriate business metrics
 Engage same audience to define an appropriate, actionable and relevant set of reports to be constructed
 Add value to the definition process in terms of best practices, best ways to visualize the data, alternate ways for presenting the information, etc.
 Develop, maintain and adhere to a schedule for the entire process
 Act as a business analyst to capture and document all decisions, report definitions, reporting terminology, nuances and know gaps in reports, etc.
 Develop SQL code and stored procedures to extract data sets for reports from existing marketing databases
 Audit all reports for accuracy prior to deployment in production
 Training and development of training materials and end-user documentation as needed

Accordingly, the ideal candidate has a) sufficient direct marketing analysis to aid in the process and definition, b) sufficient business management to understand and report on the clients business, c) project management skills to schedule and manage the entire process, and d) SQL query and procedure coding and e) documentation experience.

Required Experience
 Extracting actionable customer and marketing insights from complex and large customer databases.
 Translation of complex numeric results into easily understood reports, exhibits and business insights.
 Application of statistical techniques to marketing data
 Ability to define and extract data that tells a story
 SQL Querying and Stored Procedure development
 Data auditing and QA
 Project Management
 Documentation and development of end-user documentation
 Demonstrated ability to manage multiple, conflicting priorities
 Excellent verbal and written communication skills required  ability to interact with both project management personnel and clients
 Self-starter  ability to manage projects independently and with minimal supervision

Additional Experience Helpful:
 Direct marketing Agency or CRM experience
 Campaign management and tracking
 Reporting using off-the-shelf reporting packages or portals
